revised_title: The Development of Benzenoid Constitution in the Lignin-Peat-Coal-Series
tldr: The authors conducted a series of experiments to study the development of benzenoid constitution in the lignin-peat-coal series. They found that the main coal substance can be oxidized to a mixture of carbonic anhydride, acetic, oxalic, and benzenecarboxylic acids. The results provide insights into the maturing process of coals and contribute to understanding technical problems such as coal conversion to oil by pressure hydrogenation.
